files.Title: FastEndpoints.Config

files.Title: FastEndpoints.DontBindAttribute
files.Summary: you can prevent one or more binding sources from supplying values for a dto property decorated with this attribute.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.DontInjectAttribute
files.Summary: endpoint properties marked with this attribute will disable property injection for that property

files.Title: FastEndpoints.DontRegisterAttribute
files.Summary: classes marked with this attribute will be skipped during assembly scanning for auto registration

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EmptyObject
files.Summary: empty object class

files.Summary: a request dto that doesn't have any properties

files.Summary: a response dto that doesn't have any properties

files.Title: FastEndpoints.Endpoint<TRequest>
files.Summary: use this base class for defining endpoints that only use a request dto and don't use a response dto.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.Endpoint<TRequest, TResponse>
files.Summary: use this base class for defining endpoints that use both request and response dtos.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.Endpoint<TRequest, TResponse, TMapper>
files.Summary: use this base class for defining endpoints that use both request and response dtos as well as require mapping to and from a domain entity using a seperate entity mapper.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EndpointDefinition
files.Summary: represents the configuration settings of an endpoint

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EndpointDiscoveryOptions
files.Summary: defines how endpoint discovery and registration should be done at startup

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EndpointFactory
files.Summary: the default endpoint factory. it creates an instance of the endpoint and injects both constructor and property dependencies.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EndpointOptions
files.Summary: endpoint registration options

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EndpointSummary<TRequest>
files.Summary: a class used for providing a textual description about an endpoint for swagger

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EndpointSummary
files.Summary: a class used for providing a textual description about an endpoint for swagger

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EndpointWithMapper<TRequest, TMapper>
files.Summary: use this base class for defining endpoints that only use a request dto and don't use a response dto but uses a request mapper.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EndpointWithMapping<TRequest, TResponse, TEntity>
files.Summary: use this base class for defining endpoints that use both request and response dtos as well as require mapping to and from a domain entity.

files.Summary: use this base class for defining endpoints that doesn't need a request dto but return a response dto.

files.Summary: use this base class for defining endpoints that doesn't need a request dto but return a response dto and uses a response mapper.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EndpointWithoutRequest
files.Summary: use this base class for defining endpoints that doesn't need a request dto. usually used for routes that doesn't have any parameters.

files.Summary: specifies that the endpoint has no request dto

files.Summary: specify the mapper type of the endpoint

files.Summary: specify the response dto type of the endpoint

files.Summary: specify the request dto type of the endpoint

files.Summary: the dto used to send an error response to the client

files.Summary: base class for the event bus

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EventBus<TEvent>
files.Summary: event notification bus which uses an in-process pub/sub messaging system

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EventHubExceptionReceiver
files.Summary: inherit this class and override it's methods in order to receive event hub exceptions.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.EventReceiver<TEvent>
files.Summary: the default implementation of an event receiver that can be used to test the execution of and event.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.ExceptionHandlerExtensions
files.Summary: extensions for global exception handling

files.Title: FastEndpoints.Factory
files.Summary: a factory for instantiating endpoints/event/mappers/validators/etc. for testing purposes

files.Title: FastEndpoints.FormFieldAttribute
files.Summary: disables all other binding sources for a dto property except form fields.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.FromAttribute
files.Summary: properties decorated with this attribute will have their values auto bound from the relevant claim of the current user principal. this is a shorter alias for the [FromClaim] attribute.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.FromBodyAttribute
files.Summary:
properties decorated with this attribute will have their values auto bound from the incoming request's json body.

HINT: no other binding sources will be used for binding that property.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.FromClaimAttribute
files.Summary: properties decorated with this attribute will have their values auto bound from the relevant claim of the current user principal

files.Title: FastEndpoints.FromFormAttribute
files.Summary:
if a request dto property is decorated with this attribute, that property will be bound from complex multipart form data (including files) from the incoming request. only valid on complex type properties. only one dto property can be decorated. the incoming form data should be in the correct format. incoming content-type must be multipart/form-data

HINT: recursively binding complex object graphs from form data is less performant than binding to top level dto properties. so... use sparingly!

files.Title: FastEndpoints.FromHeaderAttribute
files.Summary: properties decorated with this attribute will have their values auto bound from the relevant http header of the current request.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.FromQueryAttribute
files.Summary:
if a request dto property is decorated with this attribute, that property will be bound from complex query parameter data from the incoming request. only valid on complex type properties. only one dto property can be decorated. the incoming query parameters should be in the correct format.

HINT: recursively binding complex object graphs from query parameters is less performant than binding to top level primitive dto properties. so... use sparingly!

files.Title: FastEndpoints.FromQueryParamsAttribute
files.Summary:
properties decorated with this attribute will be bound by obtaining the values from query string parameters with matching names.

WARNING: valid only on complex types with at least one public property. only one dto property can be decorated with this attribute.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.GlobalPreProcessor<TState>
files.Summary: inherit this class to create a global pre-processor with access to the common processor state of the endpoint

files.Title: FastEndpoints.IHasCommandType

files.Summary: implement this interface on command handler classes in order to access the

files.Summary: addon interface to enable a job storage provider () to support commands that return results.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.IPostProcessor<TRequest, TResponse>
files.Summary: defines the generic interface for a post-processor with specific types for the request and response, enabling type-safe post-processing.

files.Summary: defines the interface for a post-processor that can perform asynchronous post-processing tasks after a request has been handled.

files.Summary: defines the generic interface for a post-processor context with specific types for the request and response.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.IPostProcessorContext

files.Summary: defines the generic interface for a pre-processor with specific types for the request, enabling type-safe pre-processing.

files.Summary: defines the basic interface for a pre-processor context, containing essential properties to access request, and associated processing details.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.IRequestBinder<TRequest>
files.Summary: create custom request binders by implementing this interface. by registering a custom modelbinder for an endpoint will completely disable the built-in model binding and completely depend on your implementation of the custom binder to return a correctly populated request dto for the endpoint.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.IRequestMapper<TRequest, TEntity>

use this interface to implement a domain entity mapper for your endpoints that only has a request dto and no response dto.

app.UseFastEndpoints(c => c.Errors.UseProblemDetails())

files.Title: FastEndpoints.RegisterServiceAttribute<TService>
files.Summary:
When using the 'FastEndpoints.Generator' package, any concrete class can be decorated with this attribute to source generate extension methods in the form of .RegisterServicesFrom{assembly-name}() which can be used to automatically register services with a single call per assembly. instead of multiple calls per each service you need registered in DI.

specify the service type with the TService generic attribute argument. the service type would typically be an interface type.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.Testing.DisableWafCacheAttribute
files.Summary: the default behavior of AppFixtures is to never boot up more than one SUT/WAF no matter how many test-classes are using an AppFixture. any derived that is decorated with this attribute will result in the internal SUT/WAF not being cached and will be instantiated per each test-class in the test project.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.ThrottleAttribute
files.Summary: rate limit requests to this endpoint based on a request http header sent by the client.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.ThrottleOptions
files.Summary: global settings for throttling

files.Title: FastEndpoints.ToHeaderAttribute
files.Summary: response dto properties marked with this attribute will cause an automatic response header to be added to the http response with the value from the property that is annotated.

files.Summary: represents reflection data for a given type

files.Summary: the priviledges of the user which will be embedded in the jwt or cookie

files.Summary: provides a way to manipulate the validation failures of the current endpoint context. call to obtain an instance of the current validation context.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.ValidationFailureException
files.Summary: the exception thrown when validation failure occurs. inspect the Failures property for details.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.ValidationOptions
files.Summary: validation related options

files.Title: FastEndpoints.Validator<TRequest>
files.Summary:
inherit from this base class to define your dto validators

HINT: validators are registered as singletons. i.e. the same validator instance is used to validate each request for best performance. hance, do not maintain state in your validators.

files.Title: FastEndpoints.VersioningOptions
